references.text: AIP NZ GEN 3.1 (Figure GEN 3.1-1: New Zealand Briefing Areas)

questions.question: What kind of NOTAM is associated with an AIP amendment or SUP publication. When is that NOTAM issued and what is its purpose?
questions.answer: Trigger NOTAM. On the AIRAC effective date of the amendment or SUP. To remind users of changes that may affect their operations.

questions.question: What information is contained in a Trigger NOTAM?
questions.answer: A brief description of the contents of the amendment or supplement, the effective date, and the reference number of the amendment or supplement.

questions.question: Unless otherwise requested, how long are in-flight and pre-flight briefing NOTAMs valid for?
questions.answer: 24 hours from the time of despatch.

references.text: AIP NZ GEN 3.1 (Section 3.4.4: NOTAM and PIB)

questions.question: What publication does AIC stand for, and what information do they contain?
questions.answer: Aeronautical Information Circular. Information about flight safety, navigation, technical, administrative, or legislative matters, which doesn't qualify for a NOTAM or inclusion in the AIPNZ.

references.text: AIP NZ GEN 3.1 (Section 3.5: Aeronautical Information Circular)

questions.question: When are AICs published?
questions.answer: As required, in accordance with the AIRAC cycle.

references.text: AIP NZ GEN 3.1 (Section 3.5: Aeronautical Information Circular)

questions.question: VFR (planning and navigation) and IFR (en-route and area) charts are part of the __________.
questions.answer: AIPNZ.

questions.question: What does an AIP Update Bulletin contain?
questions.answer: New pages for AIPNZ documents, including past amendments and additions.

questions.question: Amendments to AIPNZ documents are distributed at least _____ days in advance of the effective date.
You are able to submit and terminate flight plans via the _____ website.
questions.answer: IFIS.

questions.question: Weather information (is/is not) available on the IFIS website. The two exceptions are __________ and __________ reports.
questions.answer: Is not. SIGMETs. ATIS.

questions.question: In which CAR part can you find definitions and abbreviations of terms used in aviation documents?
questions.answer: CAR Part 1

questions.question: Who does the Director refer to?
questions.answer: The Director of Civil Aviation.

questions.question: Which person is referred to as the Minister?
questions.answer: The Minister of Transport (an elected Member of Parliament).

questions.question: In aviation documents, the terms _____ or _____ indicate a rule that must be complied with, whereas the word _____ means a recommendation is being made.
questions.answer: Shall. Must. Should.

questions.question: Give the units of measurement used in New Zealand aviation for navigation distances: __________, elevation: __________, altitude and height: __________, speed: __________, vertical speed: __________, dimensions: __________, visibility: __________ or __________, temperature: __________.
questions.answer: Nautical miles. Feet. Feet. Knots. Feet per minute. Metres. Metres or kilometres. Degrees celsius.

references.text: AIP NZ GEN 2.1 (Section 1: Units of Measurement)

questions.question: What time is used for all flights within New Zealand?
questions.answer: Co-ordinated universal time (UTC).

questions.question: NZST stands for ___________________ and is _____ hours (ahead of/behind) UTC. NZDT stands for ____________________ and is _____ hours (ahead of/behind) UTC.
questions.answer: New Zealand Standard Time. 12. Ahead. New Zealand Daylight Time. 13. Ahead.

questions.question: When does NZDT begin and end?
questions.answer: Begins at 0200 NZST on the last Sunday of September. Ends at 0300 NZDT on the first Sunday in April.

questions.question: How can you get accurate time information from a radio broadcast?
questions.answer: Radio New Zealand broadcast programmes transmit time pips every hour on the hour.
